title: Raptor Codes
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Information Theory Workshop on Information Theory for Wireless Networks
abstract: A Fountain code is a code of fixed dimension and a limitless block-length. This is a class of codes with many interesting properties and applications. In this talk I will introduce several classes of probabilistic Fountain codes, including LT-and Raptor codes, show tools for their design and analysis, and discuss how they are used today to solve various data transmission problems on heterogenous unreliable networks. I will also talk about the theory of these codes when transmission takes place over non-erasure channels, and low-complexity algorithms are used for their decoding.

title: Method for the Determination of a Quality-of-Transmission Estimator along the Lightpaths of Partially Transparent Networks
conferenceTitle: 33rd European Conference and Exhibition of Optical Communication
abstract: We propose a method to determine an analytical expression of the transmission Q-factor along a lightpath in a transparent networl. We experimentally assess its accuracy on a SMF-based WDM transmission system at 10.7 Gbit/s.

title: Potential energy savings optimizing the daily operation of refrigeration systems
conferenceTitle: 2007 European Control Conference (ECC)
abstract: The objective of this study is to investigate the energy saving potential for refrigeration systems by refrigeration more at the colder night time than at the warmer day time. The potential is evaluated using a standard model predictive control formulation and illustrated on a simulation example. The results shows that the significant potential savings depends on two refrigeration system parameters and the variation of the outdoor temperature. The system dependency is illustrated in a parameter study.

title: Recent advances in brain-computer interfaces
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE 9th Workshop on Multimedia Signal Processing
abstract: A brain-computer interface (BCI) is a communication system that translates brain activity into commands for a computer or other devices. In other words, a BCI allows users to act on their environment by using only brain activity, without using peripheral nerves and muscles. The major goal of BCI research is to develop systems that allow disabled users to communicate with other persons, to control artificial limbs, or to control their environment. To achieve this goal, many aspects of BCI systems are currently being investigated. Research areas include evaluation of invasive and noninvasive technologies to measure brain activity, evaluation of control signals (i.e. patterns of brain activity that can be used for communication), development of algorithms for translation of brain signals into computer commands, and the development of new BCI applications. In this paper we give an overview of the aspects of BCI research mentioned above and highlight recent developments and open problems.

title: GMPLS extensions to Encompass Shared Regenerators in Transparent Optical Networks
conferenceTitle: 33rd European Conference and Exhibition of Optical Communication
abstract: GMPLS signaling extensions are proposed to encompass the presence of shared regenerators in transparent optical networks without routing protocol modifications. Low blocking probability is obtained with just two transparent set up attempts before using regenerators.

title: Unambiguous reconstruction and imaging of nonuniform sampling SAR signals
conferenceTitle: 2007 1st Asian and Pacific Conference on Synthetic Aperture Radar
abstract: Nonuniform sample of SAR signal will bring the noise into the signals, and thus mix the spectrum of the echo signals with that of the noises, increase ambiguity of the signals, and depress the SAR imaging quality. In wide swath SAR mode, the multi-channel receivers are used in azimuth, the nonuniform sampling will be met. This paper analyzes in detail analysis the unambiguous spectrum reconstruction of the nonuniform sampling SAR signals and multi-channel SAR imaging; Based on the difference and correlation between the multi-channels signals and single channel signal, we resolve the multi-channels SAR imaging, the simulate results prove that the theoretic analysis is correct.

title: New Findings on Coulomb Scattering Mobility in Strained-Si nFETs and its Physical Understanding
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Symposium on VLSI Technology
abstract: In this paper, the impact of strain on the electron mobility limited by Coulomb scattering (interface states Nit and substrate impurities NA), is experimentally examined for the first time. Compared to Si devices, the mobility limited by NA is enhanced in strained Si whereas the mobility limited by Nit is degraded. These new findings are explained through valleys population and scattering rate considerations. It is also found that the interface state generation in strained Si is smaller than in Si. This fact is beneficial to the device performance as well as the MOS device reliability.

title: Engineering Industrial Ecosystems in a Networked World
conferenceTitle: 2007 5th IEEE International Conference on Industrial Informatics
abstract: Summary form only given. Summarizes speech given at the conference. Engineering Industrial Ecosystems in a Networked World .

title: From Haptic Interface to Brain Interface
conferenceTitle: RO-MAN 2007 - The 16th IEEE International Symposium on Robot and Human Interactive Communication

title: Polarization Behaviour in Urban Macrocell Environments at 2.2 GHz
conferenceTitle: The Second European Conference on Antennas and Propagation, EuCAP 2007
abstract: This paper investigates the polarization behaviour of the propagation channel in urban macrocell environments at 2 GHz. The study is based on a dual polarized single-input multiple-output (SIMO) measurement campaign. The beamforming algorithm which computes the direction of arrivals (DoA) is explained. Two examples of spatio- temporal results representative of the street guided propagation and diffraction over rooftop mechanisms, are analysed. Thereafter, the study focuses on the polarization analysis. The average polarization matrix is computed and compared with previously published results. The polarization dependency with the physical propagation parameters is also investigated.

title: Experimental assessment of frequency-dependent crosstalk penalty with different 43 Gb/s modulation formats
conferenceTitle: 33rd European Conference and Exhibition of Optical Communication
abstract: We experimentally analyse the crosstalk penalty versus the frequency location of the crosstalk, show that the classical crosstalk curves can be wrong by more than 6 dB, and compare different formats and filters.

title: Broad beamwidth circularly polarized printed antenna for GPS applications
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Real-Time Requirement of Media Control Applications
conferenceTitle: 19th Euromicro Conference on Real-Time Systems (ECRTS'07)
abstract: Summary form only given. This presentation starts by describing the main functions of multimedia control applications with special emphasis on video surveillance systems. Based on this description the resource requirements of multimedia control applications are presented, in particular regarding the use of the processor, the memory, and the network bandwidth. Some real-world sequences are used to illustrate the presentation.

title: Broadband DR-loaded planar monopole
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: SelfReplication Mechanism by Means of SelfReconfiguration
conferenceTitle: 20th International Conference on Architecture of Computing Systems 2007
abstract: Ontogenetic hardware, along with epigenetic (neural) hardware and phylogenetic (evolvable) hardware, are the key representatives of a new hardware conception paradigm known as bioinspired hardware. Ontogenesis is the process that allows living beings to develop by means of mechanisms as growing, selfreplication, and selfrepair. During the last few years, such ontogenetic mechanisms have been presented as a solution for the design of complex electronic circuits, with the goal of coping with the increasing complexity envisioned for future nanotechnology devices. This paper presents an ontogenetic mechanism that allows a system, implemented in a reconfigurable device, to selfreplicate, generating an identical copy of itself, by partially selfreconfiguring the device containing it in a dynamic way.

title: A Robust Hole-Filling Algorithm for Triangular Mesh
conferenceTitle: 2007 10th IEEE International Conference on Computer-Aided Design and Computer Graphics
abstract: Summary form only given. This paper presents a novel hole-filling algorithm that can fill arbitrary holes in triangular mesh models. First, the advancing front mesh technique is used to cover the hole with newly created triangles. Next, the desirable normals of the new triangles are approximated using our desirable normal computing schemes. Finally, the three coordinates of every new vertex are re-positioned by solving the Poisson equation based on the desirable normals and the boundary vertices of the hole. Many experimental results and error evaluations are given to show the robustness and efficiency of the algorithm.

title: Aligning Architectural Approaches towards an SOA-Based Enterprise Architecture
conferenceTitle: 2007 Working IEEE/IFIP Conference on Software Architecture (WICSA'07)
abstract: Summary form only given. This tutorial will provide an overview of architecture patterns, approaches, and service oriented architecture (SOA) principles. The following topics will be discussed and illustrated with sample scenarios: model driven architecture enabling; service oriented architectures; identity enabled networks - the core service building block for service oriented architectures; event driven architecture augmenting service oriented architectures; component based architecture supplementing service oriented architectures; and utility computing architecture supporting service oriented architectures.

title: Location of an inter turns short-circuit fault in the stator windings of induction motor by neural network
conferenceTitle: 2007 IET Colloquium on Reliability in Electromagnetic Systems
abstract: In order to avoid a complete degradation of an Induction Motor (IM) and to direct the maintenance task, the detection and location of an early fault is of great concern.

title: The GALE project: A description and an update
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Workshop on Automatic Speech Recognition & Understanding (ASRU)
abstract: Summary form only given. The GALE (global autonomous language exploitation) program is a DARPA program to develop and apply computer software technologies to absorb, translate, analyze, and interpret huge volumes of speech and text in multiple languages This program has been active for two years, and the GALE contractors have been engaged in developing highly robust speech recognition, machine translation, and information delivery systems in Chinese and Arabic. Several GALE-developed talks will be given in this workshop. This overview talk will review the program goals, the technical highlights, and the technical issues remaining in the GALE project.

title: Fault detection identification and reconfiguration of flight control system using IMM estimator
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE/AIAA 26th Digital Avionics Systems Conference

title: Systematic Calibration Method for the Laser Gyro Strapdown Inertial Navigation System
conferenceTitle: 2007 Chinese Control Conference
abstract: In this paper, based on the inertial navigation equation, a novel systematic calibration model for the laser gyro strapdown inertial navigation system is proposed. The observability of the error parameters is analyzed. Then a calibration algorithm, which can identify twenty four error parameters of the inertial navigation unit is studied.

title: Keynote Speech
conferenceTitle: Third International Symposium on Information Assurance and Security

title: Order Statistics Filters in Wavelet Domain for Color Image Processing
conferenceTitle: 2007 Sixth Mexican International Conference on Artificial Intelligence, Special Session (MICAI)
abstract: In this paper we present different order statistics filters in the Wavelet domain for noise suppression in color image processing. All proposed filters are defined as two filters in the wavelet domain: the first filter is based on redundancy of approaches and the second one is the wavelet domain iterative center weighted median algorithm. With this structure different implementations for the estimation of the noisy sample are already carried out using different order statistics algorithms.

title: Houston: We are in Overload
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE International Conference on Software Maintenance
abstract: During the flight of Apollo 13, an oxygen tank blew up threatening the lives of the astronauts. When it happened, James Lovell Jr. told the Houston control center, "Hey Houston, we 've had a problem here." Although not as catastrophic, software developers productivity is being threatened by an inundation of information: source code is easier and easier to traverse and to find, email inboxes are stuffed to capacity, RSS feeds provide a continual stream of technology updates, and so on. To enable software developers to work more effectively, software engineering researchers often deliver tools, which produce even more information. The effect of more and more tools producing more and more information is placing developers into overload. It would be reasonable to here a software developer utter, "Houston: We are in overload"! In this talk, I will discuss the quagmire in which software developers are finding themselves, discuss how they are coping based on data collected from the activity of developers, and suggest ways of helping developers regain control.

title: Bandwidth enhancement of balanced folded loop antenna design for mobile handsets using genetic algorithms
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Performance Modeling and Analysis for AMD's High Performance Microprocessors
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems & Software
abstract: This talk will cover performance modeling and analysis at AMD, directed at our X86-64 processor development. Topics covered will include benchmark analysis and workload development for simulation, and simulation tools and methodologies used for power/performance analysis of our next generation of microprocessors.

title: Pricing
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Aerospace Conference

title: Security implications of radio frequency certificates of authenticity
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting

title: Review of boro arrays - a new class of antenna arrays with passive elements
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Leukocytes Image Segmentation and Extraction Based On Mathematical Morphology
conferenceTitle: 2007 Chinese Control Conference
abstract: Leukocytes image segmentation and extraction based on mathematical morphology. Its aim is to segment and extract the leukocytes, nucleus, cytoplasm and background, even in the case of closely clustered cells. This procedure gets a more accurate borderline of the interesting areas. The experiment shows that this processing method is effective and feasible.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2007 65th Annual Device Research Conference
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: A novel array synthesis method based on 2D-IDFT
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Optimal Population Size for Partheno-genetic Algorithm
conferenceTitle: 2007 Chinese Control Conference
abstract: By reviewing the number of efficient schemas that are disposed by partheno-genetic algorithm during every genetic operation, the mathematics formula researching the optimal population size of partheno-genetic algorithm is presented, and then the existence of optimal population size of partheno-genetic algorithm is demonstrated. One of the key problems in the application of partheno-genetic algorithm is reasonable selection of the population size.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE International Symposium on Industrial Electronics
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: The power losses calculation technique of electrical machines using the heat transfer theory
conferenceTitle: 2007 International Power Engineering Conference (IPEC 2007)
abstract: The paper proposes the estimation of power losses in electrical machines using a measurement technique based upon electrical machines ventilation wind temperature and a heat transfer equation. Three machine types are tested under various load conditions using the proposed technique. The first machine type are a three-phase 2.24 kW and a 3.73 kW induction motors. The second is a 4.5 kW synchronous generator. The last is a 5 kW dc machine which is operated as both motor and generator. The results show that the machine power losses calculated from the proposed technique has an error less than 4 % comparing with power losses from the experiment. Therefore, the technique can be acceptable for the estimation of power losses in electrical machine. The main advantage of this method is that the machines need not to stop or to be removed from their operation process in order to measure their losses.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2007 65th Annual Device Research Conference
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: Design of compact microstrip antenna with wide bandwidth and broad beamwidth
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Magnetic and dielectric ceramics for advanced RF applications
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Reliability Prediction in Systems with Correlated Component Failures  An Approach Using Copulas
conferenceTitle: 20th International Conference on Architecture of Computing Systems 2007
abstract: We investigate, how spatial dependencies can influence the reliability of a faulttolerant system and how such dependencies may be introduced into the reliability modeL We propose the use of copulas, a mathematical dependency representation that has proven its use in other research fields such as financial risk prediction. With a Gaussian copula representation, the dependency between components in a redundant voting system is investigated. Inducing minor changes in the strength of dependency between neighbouring components, the system reliability of a voting unit varies in the order of magnitudes.

title: [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2007 Conference on Lasers and Electro-Optics - Pacific Rim
abstract: The document that should appear here is not currently available.

title: A new minimum peak side lobe codes in radar systems
conferenceTitle: 2007 IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society International Symposium

title: Global megatrends and their effects on the production of the future
conferenceTitle: 2007 5th IEEE International Conference on Industrial Informatics
abstract: Summary form only given, as follows. Global trends - such as the vastly increasing number of megacities, the increase of the average life expectancy and the growth in world population - are changing the requirements of future production plants using discrete and process technology. In this context, one important aspect will be the continued optimizing of operational resources and raw materials to ensure the supply of acceptable resources for mankind. But the growing dynamism of the markets and ever shorter product lifecycles, too, are part of the core requirements of the Production of the Future. To implement these requirements, there are interesting approaches such as the Digital Factory, Autonomous Components or Plug&Play.

title: Surface Modeling with Polynomial Splines over Hierarchical T-meshes
conferenceTitle: 2007 10th IEEE International Conference on Computer-Aided Design and Computer Graphics
abstract: Computer graphics and computer-aided design communities prefer piecewise spline patches to represent surfaces. But keeping the smoothness between the adjacent patches is a challenging task. In this paper, we present a method for stitching several surface patches, which is a key step in complicated surface modeling, with polynomial splines over hierarchical T-meshes (PHT-spline for short). The method is simple and can be easily applied to complex surface modeling. With the method, spline surfaces can be constructed efficiently and adoptively to fit genus-zero meshes after their spherical parameterization is obtained, where only small sized linear systems of equations are involved.

title: Development of THz gyrotron FU CW series [PDF Not Yet Available In IEEE Xplore]
conferenceTitle: 2007 Joint 32nd International Conference on Infrared and Millimeter Waves and the 15th International Conference on Terahertz Electronics
abstract: For application of high frequency gyrotrons to high power THz technologies, CW operation is needed. In FIR FU, we have developed Gyrotron FU CW Series which consists of three gyrotrons. In this presentation, The present status of Gyrotron FU CW Series is summarized.

title: On Highway Tunnel Intelligent Control
conferenceTitle: 2007 Chinese Control Conference
abstract: This paper analyzed the status quo of highway tunnel control system, and pointed out that the present control system overemphasizes the realization of individual system's function and neglected the consideration of the whole effect. This paper proposed a new research approach, which was to use information fusion technology to process the detected information of tunnel equipments, take the tunnel's characteristics into consideration, and then apply intelligent control technology to the formation of whole control plan.
